text:
Please post your question to <fop-users@xmlgraphics.apache.org> instead of posting a bug report unless you have carefully checked it is truly a bug, which is likely not the case here.

Before posting your query, check that you have specified the correct encoding in your FOP input FO file, e.g., have specified an XML declaration with encoding="utf-8". Also check that you have specified a font family that contain the character to be rendered.

If that doesn't fix it, then post a query to the above email list and provide the following:

1. input FO file
2. command line or procedure you used to invoke FOP
3. command line or error output
4. output PDF file or AT file

Regards,
Glenn Adams
